title: Ford stock slips on fourth-quarter headwinds
text: Ford Motor Co. F, +1.54% shares declined in the extended session Wednesday after the truck and auto maker said it expects increased fourth-quarter headwinds. Ford shares declined 2.6% after hours, following a 1.5% rise in the regular session to close at $9.21. Ford expects adjusted earnings of $1.20 to $1.32 a share, while analysts had forecast $1.26 a share. In a statement, Ford said it lowered its outlook because of "fourth-quarter headwinds - higher warranty costs, higher than planned incentives in North America, and lower volumes in China - have intensified since Ford last gave financial guidance for 2019." The company reported third-quarter net income of $425 million, or 11 cents a share, compared with $991 million, or 25 cents a share, in the year-ago period. Adjusted earnings were 34 cents a share. Revenue declined to $36.99 billion from $37.67 billion in the year-ago quarter. Analysts surveyed by FactSet had forecast earnings of 26 cents a share on revenue of $36.87 billion.
